subject: Re: [junit] Eclipse - JUnit Configuration?
msgSnippet: I believe that is the way the plugin is written... it always uses that runner.  You don t have to use the plugin however.  You can invoke which ever runner
messageBody:
I believe that is the way the plugin is written... it always uses that
runner. You don't have to use the plugin however. You can invoke which
ever runner you'd like. But, if you don't use the plugin you won't get
the nice amenities like clicking on an error and having it take you to
the place in the code where it occurred. If you can do without that,
and you can't bear to use the remote runner, just invoke another runner.

I don't see why using the RemoteTestRunner should bother you. It's
still only accessing the localhost. Opening up the ports in your zone
alarm to localhost to allow TCP doesn't make your box insecure.
**WARNING: BIG GENERALIZATION** I think (don't quote me here) most
viruses that try to get out of your box are either going to "piggy back"
on something (like email) or are going to use UDP. So, unless you have
some really good reason to not allow connections to localhost just use
the plugin.
